intro: Orthosiphon, commonly known as Java tea, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Orthosiphon species are often cultivated for their medicinal properties, particularly in traditional medicine. The leaves are used to make herbal teas and are believed to have diuretic and anti-inflammatory effects.
